page.title: 02Exmoor National Park
page.content: Exmoor is a National Park.It is one of the smallest of the parks covering an area of 265 square miles. Dartmoor National Park lies to the south and Brecon Beacons to the north across the Bristol Channel. The coast has cliffs and beaches, with superb views of Wales. Inland is the wild moorland with deep wooded valleys and rushing streams. Exmoor is a quiet peaceful place with pretty villages and scattered farms. Many holidaymakers come to enjoy the riding,fishing and walking. They stay at hotels,Youth Hostels, guesthouses, or campsites. If you enjoy rural life, then Exmoor is a good place to live, although work is not plentiful.
